title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in Super Bowl loss to Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez, Craig Woodson, and Carlton Davis were standout players for the Patriots in their Super Bowl LX loss.
The Patriots' offensive line struggled significantly, allowing six sacks and failing to establish a ground game against the Seahawks.
Drake Maye was under constant pressure and committed three turnovers, contributing to the Patriots' 29-13 defeat.

title: What an emotional Drake Maye said of Super Bowl LX loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye and the New England Patriots lost 29-13 to the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.
Maye struggled with turnovers, throwing two interceptions and losing a fumble, leading to 17 Seahawks' points.
Despite the loss, Patriots are optimistic with Maye as franchise QB and Coach of the Year Mike Vrabel.

title: Super Bowl 2026: Bad Bunny performs joyful, controversy-free halftime show
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Bad Bunny performed a 13-minute halftime show at Super Bowl 60, celebrating Latin culture with joy and famous guests.
Guest performers included Lady Gaga, Ricky Martin, and salsa group Los Sobrinos at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California.
Despite prior criticism, the performance focused on themes of love and unity, concluding with an inclusive message on the Jumbotron.

title: Super Bowl celebrities: Here’s who was spotted in Santa Clara
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Jay-Z and his daughter Blue Ivy attended Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California.
Lady Gaga performed with Bad Bunny during the halftime show at the Super Bowl between Patriots and Seahawks.
Celebrities at the event included Adam Sandler, Kendall Jenner, Roger Federer, and musicians like Billie Joe Armstrong.

title: Mass. State Police report fake account impersonating trooper
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts State Police warn against a fake Instagram account impersonating a female state trooper with over 100,000 followers.
The account, using artificially generated images, falsely portrays the trooper and links to a free OnlyFans page.
Similar account impersonates a Santa Monica officer with different names but shared images and links.

title: In Patriots territory, Seahawks fans find a home base for the Super Bowl
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Alma Cantina on Union Street hosted a Seattle Seahawks watch party for the Super Bowl, filling to capacity.
The partnership with Seattle's fan group began two years ago, growing from a small group to dozens of fans attending.
Fans enjoyed a welcoming atmosphere for the Seahawks-Patriots Super Bowl rematch, reliving past game memories.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Stefon Diggs shoved to the ground as punches fly during sideline scuffle
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Stefon Diggs and Seattle's Josh Jobe involved in a sideline scuffle; no penalties or ejections were issued.
Josh Jobe shoved Stefon Diggs, who retaliated by grabbing Jobe; Mack Hollins and Kayshon Boutte intervened.
Stefon Diggs, facing off-field legal issues, recorded one catch for five yards as Patriots struggled against Seattle.

title: Green Line service suspended between Park Street and Government Center after train derails
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Green Line service between Park Street and Government Center was suspended after a train derailed at Park Street station.
The MBTA announced the suspension at 2:46 p.m. and the train was rerailed by 6:43 p.m. on Sunday.
Repairs and inspections at Park Street continue, with the MBTA suggesting riders use the Orange Line instead.

title: ‘Good Will Dunkin’: Watch Ben Affleck, Tom Brady, Jennifer Aniston, and more in 2026 Super Bowl commercial
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck stars in Dunkin's 2026 Super Bowl ad, a 'Good Will Hunting' parody featuring Tom Brady and '90s sitcom stars.
The commercial, titled 'Good Will Dunkin',' aired before halftime of Super Bowl LX with a nostalgic sitcom style.
Jennifer Aniston, Matt LeBlanc, and Ted Danson join the cast, delivering humor and Boston references in the ad.

title: Here’s Ann Michael Maye’s custom look for Super Bowl Sunday
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Ann Michael Maye wore a custom cropped Patriots jacket to Super Bowl LX, designed by Kristin Juszczyk.
Maye shared her Super Bowl look on social media, expressing pride and love for her husband, Drake Maye.
Ann Michael gained popularity for her baking videos and a new show, "Beyond Bakemas with Ann Michael Maye."
